data.title: Kinda cool
data.text: Tooks the kids here, they had fun for about 2 hours. Been there before, this time it was better than the time before.

data.title: Loved the Museum!!
data.text: My 7-year old loved everything about the Lake Charles Children's Museum. It was fun and interactive. We were there for three hours and didn't notice. The science show was VERY informative... a true learning experience for him. We plan to return again soon.

data.title: It's not a really a museum but it is fun.
data.text: We took our 20 month old granddaughter and she had a blast! It isn't much of a "museum" but more like a late playhouse. Yes, it isn't as clean and fresh as one would hope. The little kids have fun here so if your not a knit picky germ-a-phobe. Go check out the Children's Museum. It's worth a couple of hours of fun here in Lake Charles.

data.title: Enjoyable Trip for a Few Hours
data.text: I visited with my 4 year old grandson. He enjoyed several exhibits that were offered, especially the bubbles and water exhibit. I wasn't very impressed, but it IS geared toward children.

data.title: FUN
data.text:
I took all of my grandkids here and they all had fun playing with every thing there and doing the activities.
there is a kitchen, restaurant, grocery shopping area, jungle area, fishing area, fire truck area, different levels, one with a train set and science things, and a blow up tunnel on another level. something different to do to spend a couple of hours.

data.title: Loads of fun for kids and adults!
data.text:
My granddaughter  and stepdaughter love this museum.
There is so much to do. The both love the grocery store and pirogue.

data.title: What a Lovely Find!
data.text:
This museum was awesome. It doesn't look like much but we were pleasantly surprised. We are visitors to the area and went to get my niece and nephew out of the casino/resort area for a while. The kids loved it! There are three floors of activities and entertainment. My niece is 61/2 and my nephew is 18 months and we were there over three hours. They spent the most time on the first floor where there was a grocery and cafe area. They pretended to make groceries and cook things up at the cafe. There was a water table where the kids played with boats and learned about water power. There was a "bayou" area where the kids rowed a boat and saw themselves rowing through the bayou on a larger screen as well as a shrimp boat area where they could pretend to be fishermen, complete with rubber boots and a net. There was a rope swing, a rock wall, and a fireman's area. 

We had to drag the kids to the second floor where things got even more interesting. There was a train set, a bubble room, and KARAOKE! It was so fun--even I had a great time. They spent another hour plus on that floor. The third floor included a book nook and a shadow room. 

The staff was kind, professional, and patient. It is located in an older building but everything was clean and the staff was on top of keeping everything sanitized and in tip top shape. On our way out, the workers handed us a small paper bag with a take-home science experiment. I highly recommend this place--what a lovely find!

data.title: Great Activity for Young Children at a reasonable price.
data.text: We used to live in this area.  My grandsons really enjoyed the museum with plenty of activities to take part. There is a store inside for purchasing and for quick meals.

data.title: Children's Museum with my Grandchildren
data.text: Each time my grand-daughters from Ft Worth visit me we make a trip to the Children's Museum.  They are love it!  Never a crowd and they can go to each and every exhibit and enjoy it in an unhurried manner.  They truly love this museum and ask to go each time that they visit.  Ages 10 and &  7 years old.

data.title: Old, run down, smelly!
data.text: The Children's Museum of Lake Charles, Louisiana was far below my expectations. Just because it is housed in an old building in downtown LC doesn't mean it should be kept that way. The rooms were messy and stinky and did not reflect the pride a "museum"should have. Maybe the word museum should be removed from the business name and replaced with play-house to accurately reflect the entertainment. I was also baffled by the ages of the attendees. I had assumed that a children's museum would be more for children than teenagers. At the front entrance a  sign reads no drop offs allowed but I saw many "big kids" without supervision. The little ones were being over powered by these big kids. Even though the museum had several interesting hands-on exhibits for children and my grand daughter truly enjoyed herself, I will not plan a future visit.

data.title: Had a great time
data.text: We went with the 1st grade field trip for school. I was surprised that every kid had so much fun. No one complained!

data.title: Hours of Entertainment
data.text: I take my Grandkids every chance to enjoy learning, and having fun at the same time! There are 3 floors and hours worth of entertaining! Staff is friendly, as well.

data.title: Wonderful museum!
data.text: There is so much to do at this museum! There are lots of hands-on activities, exhibits for exploring and role-playing for little ones! There are even some live animals and Saturday activities and classes. They even host birthday parties! Very close to I-10 and lots of other downtown attractions!

data.title: Great time
data.text: Took two boys (5 and 3) explored three floors of fun activities, adults had fun too. Many science exhibits that are hands on for the kids to play with.

data.title: LC Children's Museum not what it used to be!
data.text: At the original location on Enterprise Blvd. years ago - LC Children's Museum was an excellent choice for birthday parties, play dates or for a rainy day.  HOWEVER, sadly the new version is not similar to the old.  I brought my nephew for a birthday party last month and was disappointed by the way the party was handled by staff.  Staff was not professional, and the place was a dirty mess.  Improvements needed.

data.title: Not for Little Children
data.text:
Where do I start?

1) The diaper changing table in the restroom blocks the door trapping everyone in the stall or blocking the stalls.  There is a large loose fire extinguisher on the floor under the sink that my 2 year old knocked over.  Fortunately it fell away from her feet instead of on our feet.

2) The big kid exhibits are lacking in either educational value or safety.  I wouldn't let my 2-year-old play on half of them for fear of getting hurt.  There are "exhibits" where the kids swing on ropes.  She wandered right in and almost got clobbered.  There is another exhibit where you pull yourself up by a rope, but there is a "pinching hazard" with a big warning sign.  What happens if the kid can't read?  I ended up pulling her off of that "exhibit" for safety reasons.  The rest of the "exhibits" were mediocre.  She liked the water feature.  The shopping store was pretty standard for children's museums.

3) The toddler/infant area was a padded room with 2...yes 2...toys.  The plugs were not child proofed and there is a table and chairs blocking the fire exit.  Personally I don't like table and chairs in a baby area because babies are learning to pull up.  Chair topple (see photo).  Lose the chairs and add some toys.  There was a padded feature for climbing and mirrors.

We drive to Disneyworld at least once a year and are always in search of good places to let the kids get out of the car and play.  We agreed we would never stop here again.

data.title: Dirty
data.text: Wouldn't recommend going...the place was dirty, things were broken, place was just not kept. Not sure if it was because of birthday parties going on but dont think thats should be an excuse of why items were everywhere and things broken. The bubble room had no bubbles for the kids to play with too. Wasn't very impressed...dont think I will be going back.

data.title: Horrible!
data.text: I will never again bring my children here nor have a birthday party here. Its suppose to be a "Children's Museum"  but your kids can even make any noise during a party. They were so rude when it was time for them to clean up they only gave us 2 minutes to get our stuff out. When I took us at least 5 minutes. We had to take two trips to get our stuff out! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE FOR PARTIES OR JUST TO PLAY! They are SO RUDE! I will take my money to CHUCKIE CHEESE NEXT TIME!

data.title: horrible
data.text: we had a birthday party and they were very rude and told us we had to be quiet. what children want to sit and be quiet at a bday party. never will i come again

data.title: great place to bring kids
data.text: When in Lake Charles and you have the chance to bring your children the Children's Museum located on Broad St is a great idea. I was pleasantly surprised at what there was to offer at this neat children's wonderland.
